questions.question_text_1: We have a dataset with minimum value of 0.05 and maximum value of 0.8. We are building an empirical distribution using the dataset. What is the probability (P) of finding the value 0.04 in the dataset?
question_texts: We have a dataset with minimum value of 0.05 and maximum value of 0.8. We are building an empirical distribution using the dataset. What is the probability (P) of finding the value 0.04 in the dataset?

questions.question_text_1: For a set of values, skewness = 1.25. What does this indicate?
question_texts: For a set of values, skewness = 1.25. What does this indicate?

options.option_text: Right tail is bigger than the left tail in the density plot
Left tail is bigger than the right tail in the density plot
Both the tails are bigger than normal
Both the tails are smaller than normal

questions.question_text_1: P-P plot is applicable for both continuous distributions and discrete distributions. Is the statement True or False?
question_texts: P-P plot is applicable for both continuous distributions and discrete distributions. Is the statement True or False?

questions.question_text_1: For normal distribution, Coefficient of variation (CV) is less than one. Is the statement True or False?
question_texts: For normal distribution, Coefficient of variation (CV) is less than one. Is the statement True or False?

questions.question_text_1: In a histogram plot of a set of data, if the plot shows three peaks, then the data may fit into Gaussian distribution. Is the statement True or False?

questions.question_text_1: At the significance level 0.05, chi-squared tabular value is 7.81. What do you conclude?
question_texts: At the significance level 0.05, chi-squared tabular value is 7.81. What do you conclude?

questions.question_text_1: Suppose a factory manufactures products on three machines A, B and C. Suppose 55% of total output comes from machine A, 30% of total output comes from machine B and 15% of total output comes from machine C. From the past data, it is known that 20% of products by machine A are defectives, 10% of products by machine B are defectives and 15% of products by machine C are defectives. What is the probability that the product has come from machine C given that it is a defective?  NOTE: Enter your answer in two decimal places.
question_texts: Suppose a factory manufactures products on three machines A, B and C. Suppose 55% of total output comes from machine A, 30% of total output comes from machine B and 15% of total output comes from machine C. From the past data, it is known that 20% of products by machine A are defectives, 10% of products by machine B are defectives and 15% of products by machine C are defectives. What is the probability that the product has come from machine C given that it is a defective?  NOTE: Enter your answer in two decimal places.
